intro: Hieracium meinshausenianum, commonly known as the Meinhausean hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
